page.title: 14CHURCHES
page.content:
{ THE CHURCH OF ST. EDBURGA, LEIGH } The parish church is dedicated to St. Edburga, a Saxon princess and grand-daughter of Alfred the Great, who is buried at Worcester Cathedral. It is originally a 12th century building on the site of an earlier Saxon church.
The church's particular treasure is the figure of Christ in Blessing, dating from 1220, which is now housed on the east wall of the restored Mary of Magdala Chapel. Other noteworthy features are the Norman pillars, made of Cradley stone, forming an arcade between the nave and Bransford Aisle; the Jacobean altar rails; tombs dating from the 17th century and the remains of the medieval rood screen. Most of the stained glass is Victorian.
